oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Southern Shindig - 1950-05-12 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: NBC syndication Southern Shindig, originating from WSM. Originally broadcast 1950-05-12, part 2. Personnel include David Cobb (announcer), Milton Estes (host), Owen Bradley and his Orchestra (performers), Owen Bradley Quintet (performers), the Jordanaires including Bob Hubbard (performers), Jack Shook (performer), Annie Lou & Danny (performers), Dutch Gordon (Owen Bradley Orchestra, trombone), Cecil Bailey (performer), Dottie Dillard (performer), Harry Draper (Owen Bradley Orchestra, violin, name unconfirmed), Oscar Eiler (Owen Bradley Orchestra, cello), Wilda Tinsley (Owen Bradley Orchestra, violin, name unconfirmed), Harold Johnson (Owen Bradley Orchestra, violin). Milton Estes states that this is the last program in the series, and that a Red Foley hosted program will follow on Monday. Part 1: http://cmfdigitization.cmf.int:2011/cdm/ref/collection/musicaudio/id/535
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Owen Bradley; Owen Bradley Quintet; Cecil Bailey; Dottie Dillard; Jack Shook; Annie Lou & Danny; Jordanaires
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Milton Estes reads letters from listeners [continued from part 1] -- David Cobb introduces Cecil Bailey, Dottie Dillard, Jack Shook and the Owen Bradley Quintet -- Bring Your Roses To Your Mother While She's Here (Cecil Bailey, Dottie Dillard, Jack Shook, Owen Bradley Quintet) -- Milton Estes introduces Annie Lou & Danny -- Blues Stay Away From Me (Annie Lou & Danny) -- Milton Estes introduces the string section -- When It's Springtime In The Rockies (Owen Bradley Orchestra) -- Milton Estes and David Cobb talk -- Cast and crew say goodbye -- Whispering Hope (The Jordanaires) -- Closing statement (David Cobb)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Southern shindig (Radio program); Cobb, David (Announcer); Estes, Milton, 1914-1963; Bradley, Owen; Owen Bradley Quintet; Jordanaires (Musical group); Hubbard, Bob, 1928-; Shook, Jack; Annie Lou and Danny; Dill, Annie Lou Stockard; Dill, Danny; Gordon, Dutch; Bailey, Cecil (Vocalist); Shook, Jack; Dillard, Dottie; Johnson, Harold (Musician)
